Legal_Issue: Whether the removal officer's decision to deny a deferral of removal is reasonable
Application_Facts: Applicants sought judicial review of a denied deferral of removal to Costa Rica
Decision_Outcome: The court set aside the officer's decision and remitted the case for redetermination after the humanitarian application is decided
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the removal officer's decision
Court_Ruling: Allowed the application, set aside the decision, and directed reconsideration
Defendant_Behavior: Removal officer failed to analyze conflicting medical evidence and did not provide applicants an opportunity to respond
Grounds_for_Claim: Unreasonable decision due to lack of analysis of medical evidence and procedural unfairness
Procedural_Issue: Failure to allow applicants to respond to evidence
Application_Basis: Humanitarian grounds for deferral of removal
Governing_Rule: Standard of review is reasonableness simpliciter
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Failure to analyze conflicting medical evidence
Outcome: Decision set aside; case remitted for redetermination
Cause_Description: Applicants sought judicial review of a denied deferral of removal to Costa Rica
Evidence_Handling: Medical evidence was not properly analyzed or addressed
Decision_Rationale: Decision untenable due to lack of analysis and procedural fairness
Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of opportunity for applicants to respond to evidence
